team_members.name: Dr. Govind Sethia
team_members.description: Dr. Govind Sethia is a distinguished materials scientist and currently serves as a Senior Scientist at the CSIR–Central Salt and Marine Chemicals Research Institute (CSIR-CSMCRI). His research spans advanced materials for gas adsorption, catalysis, and energy applications, with a strong emphasis on CO₂ capture and hydrogen storage technologies. Before joining CSIR-CSMCRI, Dr. Sethia held the position of Senior Manager at the Reliance Research and Development Center, a division of Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) in Mumbai, where he contributed to strategic industrial R&D in materials innovation. Dr. Sethia’s academic pedigree includes prestigious postdoctoral appointments in North America. At the Centre for Catalysis Research and Innovation (CCRI), University of Ottawa, he worked under the mentorship of Prof. Abdelhamid Sayari, focusing on the development of novel sorbent materials for CO₂ capture and hydrogen storage. He further advanced his expertise at the Center for Applied Energy Research (CAER), University of Kentucky, where he developed nanocrystalline zeolites and zeolite membranes, integral to solvent/membrane hybrid systems for post-combustion CO₂ separation from coal-fired flue gas. With over three years of international postdoctoral research and more than three years of industrial R&D leadership, Dr. Sethia brings a rare blend of academic depth and industrial pragmatism. His work continues to advance the frontiers of materials science, adsorption technology, and clean energy solutions, contributing to both scientific advancement and industrial transformation.

team_members.name: Prayag Gajera
team_members.description: Prayag Gajera is a dedicated researcher with a Master of Science degree in Organic Chemistry from RK University in Rajkot. Currently immersed in the project 'Scale-up Study on 13X Zeolite Powder Technology,' Prayag showcases his expertise and commitment to advancing innovative technologies in chemistry. His previous project, 'Development of Adsorbent for Oxygen Concentrator,' reflects his ability to tackle real-world challenges and develop practical solutions. Prayag's contributions to both projects highlight his proficiency in research methodologies and his passion for exploring new avenues in chemistry. With his strong academic background and hands-on experience, Prayag is poised to make meaningful contributions to the field and drive further advancements in materials science and technology.

team_members.name: Harshal Kulkarni
team_members.description: Harshal Kulkarni holds a Master of Science degree in Physical Chemistry, reflecting his strong foundation in the principles of physical sciences and their application in chemistry. Currently, he serves as a Project Associate, contributing his expertise to the ongoing project titled 'Scale-up Study on 13X Zeolite Powder Technology.' With his background in physical chemistry, Harshal brings a unique perspective to the project, allowing for a comprehensive exploration of the underlying principles and applications involved. His role as a Project Associate highlights his dedication to research and his commitment to advancing the field of chemistry through practical and innovative projects.

team_members.name: Rahul Parmar
team_members.description: Rahul Parmar is a distinguished scholar who was awarded the UGC-JRF in the year 2022, a prestigious recognition of his outstanding academic achievements and research potential. He holds a Master of Science degree in Inorganic Chemistry from SP University, where he demonstrated a keen intellect and deep understanding of the principles governing inorganic compounds. Rahul's dedication to his field is evident through his pursuit of advanced studies and his commitment to research excellence. With the UGC-JRF accolade, Rahul is poised to make significant contributions to the field of inorganic chemistry, furthering our understanding and application of these fundamental compounds. His passion for scientific inquiry and academic rigor positions him as a valuable asset to the scientific community and a promising researcher in his field.

team_members.name: Sagnik Mukherjee
team_members.description: Sagnik Mukherjee is a Project Associate-II at the CSIR–Central Salt and Marine Chemicals Research Institute (CSMCRI), Bhavnagar, Gujarat, India, where he conducts advanced research at the confluence of porous materials chemistry and process intensification. He completed his Ph.D. from Sardar Patel University, Gujarat, with a specialization in the design and post-synthetic modification of amine-functionalized metal-organic frameworks (MOFs), targeting enhanced basicity for catalytic applications and high-performance CO₂ adsorption. His expertise spans the synthesis and surface engineering of MOFs, zeolites, hyper-crosslinked polymers (HCPs), mesoporous silica, and biomass-derived activated carbons materials tailored for heterogeneous catalysis, photocatalysis, and gas separation technologies. His research integrates equilibrium gas adsorption using high-precision volumetric instrumentation with dynamic breakthrough analysis to evaluate materials under realistic pressure swing adsorption (PSA) conditions. Sagnik's work emphasizes elucidating structure–activity relationships, enabling the development of next-generation adsorbents and catalysts with superior selectivity, capacity, and stability. His contributions have been published in premier journals such as, Microporous and Mesoporous Materials, Carbon Trends, Colloids and Surfaces C: Environmental Aspect, and Catalysis Letters etc., advancing the frontiers of sustainable and scalable materials for environmental and industrial processes.

team_members.name: Chandresh R. Bari
team_members.description: Chandresh holds a postgraduate degree in Analytical Chemistry from the University of Mumbai. With a strong passion for research and science, he began his career in the R&D division of a renowned industry. He is currently part of a project titled Speciality Chemicals for Industrial Applications at CSIR-CSMCRI. His research primarily focuses on adsorbents, porous materials, and silica-based materials, contributing to the development of innovative solutions for industrial applications.

alumni_members.name: Dr. Dimple K Bora
alumni_members.description: Dr. Dimple K. Bora earned her PhD from the Academy of Scientific and Innovative Research (AcSIR), where she developed ruthenium-anchored aminated MWCNT/polyaniline membrane electrode assemblies for efficient alkaline water splitting. She specializes in electrocatalysis, nanomaterials, and clean hydrogen technologies, contributing to the advancement of sustainable energy systems.
